author: Hadlee Simons
title: Pornhub compares Android, iOS habits
text:
Pornhub has published another one of its insightful blog posts. 
This time, the adult streaming service compares the behaviour of Android users to iOS fans. 
"Now that the highly anticipated iPhone 6s line has finally hit stores and is smashing sales records, the Pornhub statisticians have decided to dig through the data and found out what it is that separates iPhone-wielding Pornhub users from our Android-loyal visitors, in terms of how they interact with the site and what kinds of content they prefer," the company said in the blog post . 
So what juicy details did they find? 

Android vs iOS 
Well, when it comes to total traffic, iOS has a 32 percent share compared to Android's 31 percent. Other platforms, including the desktop, take the remaining 37 percent. 
Looking at phone-only traffic and Android pulls ahead with 52 percent compared to 42 percent on iOS (six percent goes to other mobile platforms). 
The situation is reversed when looking at tablet traffic, with iOS tablets (iPads) making up a mammoth 68 percent compared to Android's 30 percent. 
What about time spent on the website? 
"If we're going for efficiency here, iOS-based users get the job done faster. They tend to spend a mere eight minutes and 40 seconds on site when they visit Pornhub and tend to reach satisfaction after just 9.8 page views," the website explained. 
"There is also an argument to be made for lasting power, which is where Android users shine. They spend a leisurely average 10:06 per visit and peak out at 10.9 page views." 
And the most popular search terms? 
The top three search terms on Android are "lesbian", "cartoon" and "black", while the top three search terms on iOS are "lesbian", "step mom" and "teen". 
The company also covered the most popular mobile operating systems, based on traffic to Pornhub. 
Unsurprisingly, the African continent was fully behind Android, with much of Asia and Europe following suit too. Apple's mobile platform dominated in the USA, Canada, the UK, Australia, Japan and several other countries. Read More
